intro: Iresine verschaffeltii, commonly known as the red-veined strobilanthes, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant, jewel-toned foliage, with deep red veins contrasting against bright green or purple leaves. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Iresine verschaffeltii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
